metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2183 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the scan_get_next_rmap_item function in mm/ksm.c in theLinux kernel before 2.6.39.3, when Kernel SamePage Merging (KSM) isenabled, allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a craftedapplication.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2183` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.7
No subscription required

linux-image-3.1.10-8-grouper - 3.1.10-8.28
No subscription required

linux-image-3.0.0-3-maguro - 3.0.0-3.18
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-3-mako - 3.4.0-3.21
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-4-manta - 3.4.0-4.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-flo - 3.4.0-1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-goldfish package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.0-1.7').
